comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
One of a great series of photos made when the buildings were almost completed, and not yet occupied by the Lunatic Asylum.  See others from the series also on Flickr -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5061232780/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3682753313/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3683567050/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
" ... There is a large water tower 100 feet high, which contains two large tanks for supplying water in case of fire. One of these tanks is at an elevation of 34 feet, contains 14,987 gallons, and weighs 67 tons; the second has an elevation of 74 feet, contains 14,250 gallons of water, the weight being 63 1/2 tons. The water is forced into them by a Targye pump, placed there for the express purpose ... "
Read all about it - SMH 16/06/1885 p.5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13591166

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I am not sure whether the posts are marking the underground water tanks. From the same newspaper article -
" ... An ample supply of water has been provided by the excavation of two underground tanks, each 152 feet in length, 50 foot wide, and 20 foot and 3 inches in depth, the tanks when filled containing together 1,886,*52 gallons. ..."

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The tower door (see note) has an insciption carved above it - V I R - Victoria Imperator Regina MDCCCLXXXIII - 1883 See investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp...
